page.title: 14Gowerton Cricket Club.
page.content: In 1884 a report in a newspaper of the time told the score of a match involving Gower Road C.C.This was the original title of the present day Gowerton C.C.The first report of a match involving the Gowerton club was reported in 1886.The club was founded in 1880 by Major J.Roper Wright,a local businessman of the time. During the 1930's a dangerous new way was discovered of watching the matches for nothing,the people would climb onto the railway bridge overlooking the pitch in order to view the games for nothing. The decade 1970-1980 was a memorable one for the club.In 1973 they reached the final of the Haig Village Knockout Trophy at Lords but narrowly lost.However in 1975 they played Ilseham in the final and won the trophy.814 teams had entered.
